Sequence Information.Source: amino acid SUBSTITUTION, insects, animal-derived, natural derivatives
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: The S-S bond is indispendsible for activity against E. coli.

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (95.24%) tothanatinK=R: 14%, I=G=P=S: 10%.Activity: active against M. luteus 3347 (MIC 0.3 uM) and E-coli JM109 (MIC >40 uM). Warning: other bacteria not tested.
Literature Information.Author: Imamura T, Yamamoto N, Tamura A, Murabayashi S, Hashimoto S, Shimada H, Taguchi S. 2008
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2008 May 2;369(2):609-15. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2008.02.057.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: NMR based structure-activity relationship analysis of an antimicrobial peptide, thanatin, engineered by site-specific chemical modification: Activity improvement and spectrum alteration.
